intro: Thalictrodes elata, commonly known as the tall thalictroid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Triuridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. The plant produces small, clustered fruiting structures that contain seeds dispersed by wind. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
